results.definition: ahead in development; complex or intricate

examples: had advanced views on the subject
at that time the most advanced outpost was still east of the Rockies

results.definition: at a higher level in training or knowledge or skill
examples: special seminars for small groups of advanced students at the University

results.definition: comparatively late in a course of development
examples: the illness had reached an advanced stage

results.definition: farther along in physical or mental development
examples: the child's skeletal age was classified as `advanced'
children in the advanced classes in elementary school read far above grade average

results.definition: (of societies) highly developed especially in technology or industry
